lines.text: So Phil, where is your car anyways?
In the zoo.
Oh, of course. I should've guessed.
You have a choice, you can either run away with me and be happy, or get married for Aunt Doodie from Portland.
Phillip, how do you think Jason would feel if I just ran away with you?
Damn it! What about you? What about how you feel?

[after calling Jason and receiving an answer from a woman he's cheating on her with]
Yeah, yeah, all right! OK! Yeah! If that's the way you want it, Jason, Fine! I'm cautious. I'm cautious and you're Rin-tin-tin!
[last lines]

[to the bears]
Well, fellas, I came close didn't I? I met her. I gave it my best shot. It was so great. That ought to last me for a while.

[after leaving her unfaithful fiancé at the altar]
Did you know that the North American Black Bear is over 200,000 years old? And it lives primarily along the Minnesota, North Dakota, Canadian borders.
You must know a lot about bears.
Oh, yes! Zoology at Stanford.
Excuse me but, Aren't you Marlin Perkins?
Oh! You recognized me.
[removes her veil]
Well, the dress did have me fooled for a minute. You're not from around here, are you?
Oh, no! I'm sorry but I did spend a lot of time in the arctic circle, you know.
Excuse me, just one second.
What?
[they kiss]
That was great. Thank you! I feel so much better. And what were you saying?
Uh, I don't remember.
You know of course that bears are anonymous in life.
No! Is that true?
I don't know but it sounds good.
Well, Phil, where do we go from here?
Anywhere. Anywhere but Acapulca.
Acapulca.
Right! You see I'm wanted there.
No! You're wanted here.
Phillip tells truck driver "El auto es flambe"
So, did you get lucky while I was gone? Seriously, did you have a good weekend?
Yes, as a matter of fact, I did.
What did you do?
Oh, the usual, flew to Acapulco, had a wild affair, came back yesterday.
With anyone I know?
I don't know. I don't think you would really like him. His name is Phillip Reed. You ever heard of him?
